author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! âœ…

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock]

This PR should have been merged by now but is stuck from a git conflict inside the General registry. You could try registering it again, preferably from the same commit, to see if that unsticks it. Otherwise it needs the attention from someone with sufficient permissions in this repository.

[noblock]
Okay, I am going to try it again
[noblock] I think it would be better if I try in a new PR

[noblock] 

@imohag9 Can you re-trigger Registrator? That will fix the merge conflict here.
[noblock] I tried and I got this error message : Error while trying to register: Changing package names not supported yet .

[blocking]

I have a couple of different questions:
1. What happened to your other repository https://github.com/imohag9/POMLUtils.jl.git? It looks like that repo was deleted?
2. How did you generate the UUID for this repo? It looks like this repo and POMLUtils.jl have the same UUID?

[noblock]
1. The POMLUtils repository was deleted , the package was not accepted because of naming conflict with MLUtils.jl .
2. the UUID for POMLSDK.jl was generated normally( I use PkgTemplates.jl). I can not confirm or deny if both packages have the same UUID but I don't think so.

> The POMLUtils repository was deleted

I would generally recommend to avoid _deleting_ GitHub repos. You can archive it, or rename it, using the GitHub user interface.

> the package was not accepted because of naming conflict with MLUtils.jl .

That was a false positive. In fact, the registration _was_ merged: https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138169. I probably should have added a comment when overriding the name similarity issue to make sure you are notified.

For now, I think the easiest way to deal with this is to revert https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138169.

> the UUID for POMLSDK.jl was generated normally( I use PkgTemplates.jl)

Just to clarify: The original `POMLUtils` and the new `PomlSDK` have the same purpose, and the same code (up to modifications from the last three weeks). Is that correct? That is, conceptually `PomlSDK` is a _rename_ of `POMLUtils`?

While we're sorting this out, I wonder if we can revisit the package name. I'm not super enthusiastic about `PomlSDK`: `POML` is still an acronym, and I think it should be in all-caps when used as part of a package name. That would be `POMLSDK`, which would violate the not-all-caps-rule. `SDK` is also a somewhat meaningless suffix. I actually think that the original `POMLUtils` was a _better_ name, even though `Utils` is also one of those less-than-descriptive suffixes. Maybe there's something more descriptive (but I haven't had any good ideas). If nobody comes up with something good, `POMLUtils` is still something we can go back to... but even then, we should probably revert https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138169 first, since you probably can't guarantee that you can still reproduce the tree-hash of the original release, having deleted the repo. In that case, generate a completely new UUID, just for good measure.

[noblock]
First , I want to apologize for any inconveniance . It's hilarious that It took me like 3 days to write the package and the registration process  got this complex ðŸ™‚.
 I had naming conflicts before and it was solved using the same approch : 
I just create a new package with same code (different UUID) and a valid name and retrigger Registrator . A registry maintainer would then close the registration process of the old package and validate the new one . I just delete the repository after because it is useless after merging the package to the registry. I guess this time I just didn't get notified that the original name was accepted ("POMLUtils.jl") and that caused this issue.
Finally,  I thank all the Registry maintainers for the feedback and help . I should not delete repos in the future until the merging is done .That would be more pratical.

> I had naming conflicts before [â€¦]

For future reference, the automatic "name similarity check" is probably 90% false positives. It is also easy to override. So generally, wait and see if there's some other response about a naming conflict, before actually going ahead and renaming the repository.

> [â€¦] and it was solved using the same approch: I just create a new package with same code (different UUID) and a valid name and retrigger Registrator 

I would not recommend that approach. Instead, see the [FAQ entry for "What to do when asked to reconsider/update the package name?"](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#what-to-do-when-asked-to-reconsiderupdate-the-package-name). Most importantly, use the GitHub UI to _rename_ the repository. This will then forward all URLs from the old project to the new project.

You also (usually) don't really need a new UUID. In this case, it seems like you actually kept the UUID and triggered the "problem", but the "problem" was only that the package was already registered as `POMLUtils`. 

> I should not delete repos in the future until the merging is done

Generally, don't delete repos at all after they've been "in public" in any significant wayâ€¦ including having been used for a registration.

Anyway. So now that https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/139294 is merged, _in principle_ this PR could probably be unblocked and merged.

Still, my recommendation would be to go back to `POMLUtils` (or an even better name, if you or someone else can think of one), using the [FAQ instructions](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#what-to-do-when-asked-to-reconsiderupdate-the-package-name).

Does all of this make sense? If you need more help, let me know.
[noblock] I think I am going to stick to PomlSDK.jl for now .Thanks.

Well, that puts me in a tricky position, since I feel quite strongly about

> POML is still an acronym, and I think it should be in all-caps when used as part of a package name.

I'm also surprised: Wasn't `POMLUtils` your first choice for a package name, and you only changed it because of the naming conflict? Why do you now think that `PomlSDK` is a _better_ name?

> for now

[Registered packages cannot be renamed](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#how-do-i-rename-an-existing-registered-package), so "for now" isn't really a thing

[noblock] 
So, after writing a package ,choosing a name , getting flagged for being too close to MLUtils, I regenerated a new package with a new name and tried to register it ,that needed reverting the julia Registry to solve an issue, and now I am supposed to explain why PomlSDK instead of the original name ? to satisfy your "strong feeling about abbreviations " requirement, I guess ...
No i'm not going to do that . 
This process took too much time and effort .
I insist on PomlSDK.jl as a package name , and this is my final comment in this PR. Merging it would end this.
I appreciate all the feedback . Thanks.

[noblock]
Why is this not merged yet ?

> No i'm not going to do that [â€¦] This process took too much time and effort.

Sorry, but that kind of response is not acceptable to me. The general registry is a shared resource for the community, and upholding consistent and suitable package names is an important part of that. I don't think we're doing ourselves any favors by adding packages that willfully ignore that aspect of the community.

I would point out the "time and effort" has been mostly on the part of the registry maintainers sorting out this situation, even if it originated from an understandable mistake on your part.

I object to the merging of this package

Amazing. This decision was based solely on your objective opinion and I thought that I only have to comply to the Registry guidelines and not on individual whims or random sentiments.
Good to know .

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]

body:

title: New package: PomlSDK v0.1.0
